questions.question: Compared to other highway users, motorcyclists:
choices: Have the same rights and responsibilities
Have less rights and more responsibilities
Have more rights and less responsibilities

questions.question: When passing a truck, you should pass:
choices: On either side, it doesn't matter

questions.question: If you see orange construction signs and cones on a highway, you must:
choices: Slow down because the lane ends ahead
Decrease distance between you and any car ahead
Be on the look-out for signs, workers and equipment ahead

questions.question: When you see a sign with this shape and color, you must:
choices: Stop completely and wait for a green light
Slow down and enter the intersection with caution
Stop completely and check for pedestrians and cross traffic

questions.question: When it starts to rain or snow:
#6. When an emergency vehicle using flashing lights approaches you from behind, you must:
choices: Drive to the right edge of the road and slow down
Pull to the right and stop
Proceed at normal speed, the emergency vehicle will move over to pass

questions.question: If an oncoming vehicle is drifting head-on into your lane, it is dangerous to:
When should you use your high-beam headlights?
choices: At night and when it is raining

questions.question: Which is one factor that significantly affects your stopping distance?
choices: Type and condition of safety belts

questions.question: Always allow extra room in front of your vehicle when:
To stay awake on a long trip, you should do all the following except:
choices: Get a normal night's sleep before you leave

questions.question: You may only overtake another vehicle on the right on a two-lane, two-way roadway if:
choices: The vehicle you are passing is about to stop
The vehicle you are passing is about to make a left turn

questions.question: A right turn against a red light is:
choices: Permitted after a complete stop and if no sign prohibits turning

questions.question: A second offense of Driving While Under the Influence (DUI), will result in a revocation of the driver's license for:
When a school bus with flashing red lights stops on the other side of a four-lane roadway with a median separation, you should:
choices: Stop only when the bus has stopped in a loading zone and pedestrians may cross the roadway.

questions.question: What is the background color on a road sign like this?
When making a right turn, do not:
choices: Signal at least 100 feet before the turn

questions.question: When you see a sign with this shape, color, and symbol, you must:
choices: Stop completely and yield to pedestrians and cross traffic

questions.question: Parking is never allowed:
choices: In front of a rural mailbox

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
choices: The divided highway on which you are traveling ends ahead
There will be fewer lanes ahead
The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways

questions.question: Which is an appropriate restraint system for a child who is three years old and weighs less than 40 lbs.?
Before turning left or right, you must signal during the last:
Crossing a double solid yellow line on your left is:
choices: Allowed if you are turning into or out of a private road or driveway
Only allowed if you are in an emergency

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
choices: Go left or straight ahead only

questions.question: Consuming alcohol significantly affects your:
At a railroad crossing, you must give trains the right-of-way:
choices: Only if red lights are flashing
Only if a crossing gate is lowered

questions.question: Unless otherwise posted, what is the speed limit on interstate highways?
Which of the following is generally illegal when driving on a freeway?
choices: Keeping to the right when driving slower than other vehicles
Going to the next exit when you miss your exit

questions.question: When entering or crossing a city street from a driveway, you must:
You must always keep proof of your liability insurance:
choices: In your vehicle whenever it is being operated
In your home or at work

questions.question: Which is an appropriate restraint system for a child who is 5 years old and weighs more than  40 lbs.?
A large truck turns right onto a street with two lanes in each direction. The truck:
choices: May need to swing wide to complete the turn
Must always stay in the right lane when turning
Will always complete its turn in the left lane to eliminate a wide turn

questions.question: In this situation (approaching the bicyclist from behind), you should:
choices: Slow down, keep distance, and pass only when it is safe
Flash your headlights and pass on the other half of the roadway
Honk your horn and pass on the other half of the roadway

questions.question: A combination of these two signs tells you:
choices: The location of a pedestrian crossing

questions.question: What does this sign mean?
If your driving privileges have been suspended by another state, you may obtain an Alabama driver license:
choices: Only after that state's suspension has been terminated
Only after passing all required tests again

questions.question: This sign (red X) means:
choices: You are not allowed to drive in the lane beneath the sign

questions.question: Stop lines, crosswalks, and parking spaces are marked with:
Why should you always look carefully for motorcycles before changing lanes?
choices: It is illegal for motorcycles to share traffic lanes
Motorcycles may be difficult to see

questions.question: Assuming you are traveling 65 mph and suddenly need to stop. How far will your car usually go before you react and start braking (0.75 seconds)?
How many points will be added to your driving record after a conviction of texting while driving?
A blind spot is the area of the road:
choices: You see in your side mirror
You cannot see without looking over your shoulder
You cannot see beyond the area lighted by your headlights

questions.question: #43. You must obey an instruction from a school patrol member in a school crossing, even if the instruction conflicts with existing signals:
A three-point turn should only be used:
choices: Where there are no pavement markings
Where you can be seen for a great distance and do not endanger other traffic

questions.question: When you park on a hill headed uphill, and there is no curb, you should turn your front wheels:
choices: Parallel to the side of the road

questions.question: Near schools, you should be alert to:
What is the best thing to do if you experience sleepiness behind the wheel?
choices: Pull over immediately at a safe place

questions.question: Under certain conditions, you may receive a ticket for speeding even if you drive at or less than the posted speed limit:
This sign means
choices: You must wait for the green light before turning
When the light is green, you must continue straight

questions.question: If you have been drinking alcohol, what will help you to sober up?
Road signs that are black or white show:
choices: Guidance to parks and public recreation

questions.question: When leaving a freeway with a deceleration lane:
choices: Avoid signaling until you are leaving the deceleration lane
Slow down well ahead of the deceleration lane
Do not slow down until you move into the deceleration lane

questions.question: The driver in front of you signals (left arm extended horizontally out of an open window ):
choices: That he plans to turn left
That he plans to turn right
That he is preparing to slow down or stop

questions.question: When you approach a railroad crossing without warning signals, stop signs, or crossing gates:
choices: Keep speed and cross the tracks quickly

questions.question: If your vehicle starts to skid or hydroplane, you should:
choices: Try to steer off the road

questions.question: When you have a green light at an intersection, and a blind pedestrian enters the intersection in front of your car, you should:
choices: Stop and stay stopped until the pedestrian has crossed

questions.question: To avoid glare from the high-beam headlights of an approaching car:
choices: Focus on the center line on the road
Adjust your instrument lights so they are brighter
Look to the right-hand edge of the road

questions.question: The blood alcohol concentration (BAC) level at which it is illegal for any person 21 years or older to drive is:
